verses.verse: Who <S%H4310><s%> is as the wise <S%H2450><s%> man? and who <S%H4310><s%> knows <S%H3045><s%> the interpretation <S%H6592><s%> of a thing? <S%H1697><s%> a man's <S%H120><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%> makes his face <S%H6440><s%> to shine, <S%H215><s%> and the boldness <S%H5797><s%> of his face <S%H6440><s%> shall be changed. <S%H8132><s%>
I counsel you to keep <S%H8104><s%> the king's <S%H4428><s%> commandment, <S%H6310><s%> and that in regard <S%H5921><s%> <S%H1700><s%> of the oath <S%H7621><s%> of God. <S%H430><s%>

Be not hasty <S%H926><s%> to go <S%H3212><s%> out of his sight: <S%H6440><s%> stand <S%H5975><s%> not in an evil <S%H7451><s%> thing; <S%H1697><s%> for he does <S%H6213><s%> whatever <S%H3605><s%> <S%H834><s%> pleases <S%H2654><s%> him.
Where <S%H834><s%> the word <S%H1697><s%> of a king <S%H4428><s%> is, there is power: <S%H7983><s%> and who <S%H4310><s%> may say <S%H559><s%> to him, What <S%H4100><s%> do <S%H6213><s%> you?

Whoever keeps <S%H8104><s%> the commandment <S%H4687><s%> shall feel <S%H3045><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> thing: <S%H1697><s%> and a wise <S%H2450><s%> man's heart <S%H3820><s%> discerns <S%H3045><s%> both time <S%H6256><s%> and judgment. <S%H4941><s%>

Because <S%H3588><s%> to every <S%H3605><s%> purpose <S%H2656><s%> there is time <S%H6256><s%> and judgment, <S%H4941><s%> therefore the misery <S%H7451><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> is great <S%H7227><s%> on him.
For he knows <S%H3045><s%> not that which <S%H4100><s%> shall be: for who can tell <S%H5046><s%> him when <S%H3588><s%> <S%H834><s%> it shall be?

There is no <S%H369><s%> man <S%H120><s%> that has power <S%H7989><s%> over the spirit <S%H7307><s%> to retain <S%H3607><s%> the spirit; <S%H7307><s%> neither <S%H369><s%> has he power <S%H7983><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of death: <S%H4194><s%> and there is no <S%H369><s%> discharge <S%H4917><s%> in that war; <S%H4421><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> shall wickedness <S%H7562><s%> deliver <S%H4422><s%> those that are given <S%H1167><s%> to it.

All <S%H3605><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> have I seen, <S%H7200><s%> and applied <S%H5414><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> to every <S%H3605><s%> work <S%H4639><s%> that is done <S%H6213><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun: <S%H8121><s%> there is a time <S%H6256><s%> wherein <S%H834><s%> one man <S%H120><s%> rules <S%H7980><s%> over another to his own hurt. <S%H7451><s%>

And so <S%H3651><s%> I saw <S%H7200><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> buried, <S%H6912><s%> who had come <S%H935><s%> and gone <S%H1980><s%> from the place <S%H4725><s%> of the holy, <S%H6918><s%> and they were forgotten <S%H7911><s%> in the city <S%H5892><s%> where <S%H834><s%> they had so <S%H3651><s%> done: <S%H6213><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> is also <S%H1571><s%> vanity. <S%H1892><s%>

Because <S%H834><s%> sentence <S%H6599><s%> against an evil <S%H7451><s%> work <S%H4639><s%> is not executed <S%H6213><s%> speedily, <S%H4120><s%> therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> the heart <S%H3820><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> is fully <S%H4390><s%> set in them to do <S%H6213><s%> evil. <S%H7451><s%>

Though a sinner <S%H2398><s%> do <S%H6213><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> an hundred <S%H3967><s%> times, and his days be prolonged, <S%H748><s%> yet <S%H3588><s%> surely <S%H3588><s%> I know <S%H3045><s%> that it shall be well <S%H2896><s%> with them that fear <S%H3373><s%> God, <S%H430><s%> which <S%H834><s%> fear <S%H3372><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him:

But it shall not be well <S%H2896><s%> with the wicked, <S%H7563><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> shall he prolong <S%H748><s%> his days, <S%H3117><s%> which are as a shadow; <S%H6738><s%> because <S%H834><s%> he fears <S%H3373><s%> not before <S%H6440><s%> God. <S%H430><s%>

There is a vanity <S%H1892><s%> which <S%H834><s%> is done <S%H6213><s%> on the earth; <S%H776><s%> that there be just <S%H6662><s%> men, to whom <S%H413><s%> it happens <S%H5060><s%> according to the work <S%H4639><s%> of the wicked; <S%H7563><s%> again, there be wicked <S%H7563><s%> men, to whom <S%H413><s%> it happens <S%H5060><s%> according to the work <S%H4639><s%> of the righteous: <S%H6662><s%> I said <S%H559><s%> that this <S%H2088><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> is vanity. <S%H1892><s%>

Then I commended <S%H7623><s%> mirth, <S%H8057><s%> because <S%H834><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> has no <S%H369><s%> better <S%H2896><s%> thing under <S%H8478><s%> the sun, <S%H8121><s%> than <S%H3588><s%> <S%H518><s%> to eat, <S%H398><s%> and to drink, <S%H8354><s%> and to be merry: <S%H8055><s%> for that shall abide <S%H3867><s%> with him of his labor <S%H5999><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of his life, <S%H2416><s%> which <S%H834><s%> God <S%H430><s%> gives <S%H5414><s%> him under <S%H8478><s%> the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

When <S%H834><s%> I applied <S%H5414><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> to know <S%H3045><s%> wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> and to see <S%H7200><s%> the business <S%H6045><s%> that is done <S%H6213><s%> on the earth: <S%H776><s%> (for also <S%H1571><s%> there is that neither <S%H1571><s%> <S%H369><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> nor night <S%H3915><s%> sees <S%H7200><s%> sleep <S%H8142><s%> with his eyes: <S%H5869><s%>)

Then I beheld <S%H7200><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the work <S%H4639><s%> of God, <S%H430><s%> that a man <S%H120><s%> cannot <S%H3808><s%> <S%H3201><s%> find <S%H4672><s%> out the work <S%H4639><s%> that is done <S%H6213><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun: <S%H8121><s%> because <S%H834><s%> though <S%H834><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> labor <S%H5998><s%> to seek <S%H1245><s%> it out, yet he shall not find <S%H4672><s%> it; yes <S%H1571><s%> farther; though <S%H518><s%> a wise <S%H2450><s%> man think <S%H559><s%> to know <S%H3045><s%> it, yet shall he not be able <S%H3201><s%> to find <S%H4672><s%> it.
